page.title: 14Natural History of the woods
page.content: A variety of interesting woodland and farmland wildlife occur.{Polecats, {Grey Squirels,}and{Foxes}are all common. The{Polecat}is rarely seen because it is nocturnal. Birds of prey are well represented as the natural {Oak}woods provide ideal nesting habitats while the absence of gamekeepers means they have fewer threats from man. The{Buzzard}occurs in large numbers, as many as 18 {Buzzards}having been seen hunting for worms on a field near Llangeitho. The rare{Red Kite}is still quite common around Llangeitho and at anytime of the year it may be seen swooping low over the village. On Llangeitho Show day it is nearly always seen circling overhead. People act as an actual lure for the kite. Other birds of prey found around Llangeitho are the dashing{Sparrowhawk}and the{Tawny Owl.
